meanings.sent1: She decided to remap the route to avoid traffic.
meanings.sent2: The artist remapped the colors in the painting to create a new effect.
meanings.sent3: After getting lost, they had to remap their journey on the fly.
meanings.sent4: The scientist remapped the brain to study the effects of memory loss.
meanings.sent5: The explorer had to remap the terrain after discovering a hidden valley.

meanings.definition: The act of changing the mapping of a computer program or device.
meanings.sent1: The remapping of the software improved its performance.
meanings.sent2: During the upgrade, the technician performed a complete remapping of the system.
meanings.sent3: The accidental remapping of the keys caused confusion among the users.
meanings.sent4: The remapping of the network led to faster data transfer speeds.
meanings.sent5: The remapping of the hard drive resolved the storage issues.

meanings.definition: The process of reassigning functions or values to different keys or buttons.
meanings.sent1: The remapping of the controls made the game easier to play.
meanings.sent2: The remapping of the shortcuts on the keyboard increased productivity.
meanings.sent3: The remapping of the remote control accidentally turned on the TV.
meanings.sent4: The remapping of the car's buttons allowed for customized settings.
meanings.sent5: The remapping of the functions on the phone simplified the user experience.
